text:
Hi everyone, been a member for a month or so, great insightful group, really happy to be here.

I do have a quick question….“TOO_MANY_REQUESTS” error.
This was introduced a few months back (just before the lockdown) and until now i’ve not really paid too much attention to it…. however its screwing me over big time now that racing is back. Your orders basically get denied if you attempt more than 1000 per second

I was just wondering is this something that applies across the board or is it only for non PC users? I remember someone once saying upper-tier PC users don’t pay a transactions charge and this kind of feels similar.

This really sucks because it looks like i am going to lose my only viable strategy, I’ve had a great 18 months out of it but to see things end because of a crappy rule change is a real shame

I do have a quick question….“TOO_MANY_REQUESTS” error.
This was introduced a few months back (just before the lockdown) and until now i’ve not really paid too much attention to it…. however its screwing me over big time now that racing is back. Your orders basically get denied if you attempt more than 1000 per second

I was just wondering is this something that applies across the board or is it only for non PC users? I remember someone once saying upper-tier PC users don’t pay a transactions charge and this kind of feels similar.

This really sucks because it looks like i am going to lose my only viable strategy, I’ve had a great 18 months out of it but to see things end because of a crappy rule change is a real shame

text: 1000 requests per second is pretty insane

elements.text: 1000 requests per second is pretty insane

text: Is your strategy really reliant on that?

elements.text: Is your strategy really reliant on that?

text: Plus if you’re placing 1000 orders a second... I dread to think what your transaction charges would be

elements.text: Plus if you’re placing 1000 orders a second... I dread to think what your transaction charges would be

text:
They do rack up quite quickly…. I need to be first to market as soon as the markets open up…. you do quickly eat through the attempts, especially when;
• betfair publish 10 markets at once (as they did today @ 13:08) 
• there is a delay of over a second between the publish time and when you can actually place orders… so you retry a few times
• each individual runner (not market) accounts for 1 attempt

elements.text: They do rack up quite quickly…. I need to be first to market as soon as the markets open up…. you do quickly eat through the attempts, especially when;
betfair publish 10 markets at once (as they did today @ 13:08)
there is a delay of over a second between the publish time and when you can actually place orders… so you retry a few times
each individual runner (not market) accounts for 1 attempt

text: Ive actually never had a transaction charge

elements.text: Ive actually never had a transaction charge

text: If you don’t have an account manager I guess I would try asking Neil

elements.text: If you don’t have an account manager I guess I would try asking Neil

text: But I think it will boil down to is what you’re doing adding value to the exchange. Do other exchange users benefit from you seeding early markets or are you taking advantage by spamming orders?

elements.text: But I think it will boil down to is what you’re doing adding value to the exchange. Do other exchange users benefit from you seeding early markets or are you taking advantage by spamming orders?

text: have you tried being naughty and using some of the private API's for placing orders?

elements.text: have you tried being naughty and using some of the private API's for placing orders?

text:
Yeah I’ve had a few back and forwards with Neil (assuming you mean the guys on their helpdesk)… he seems a good guy… i think he’s probably fed up of me hounding him over this.

I certainly wouldn’t say I’m spamming, betfair publish a market and I place my bets fast, in the event of a failure I retry, speed is imperative for many strategies (from what i can gather).

Private APIs? …. never heard of them, keen to learn tho!!! what are they for?

text: Yeah that’s the Neil I mean. If you already have a dialogue with him that’s who I would ask in the first place

text: ok cool, thank you

text: you can try using the exchange transactional subdomain however not sure where the order count gets executed, if its further down the stack it won't help

elements.text: you can try using the exchange transactional subdomain however not sure where the order count gets executed, if its further down the stack it won't help

text: Have you tried optimising a local delay to placing your orders, balancing the chance of getting there first versus having your orders not be rejected?

elements.text: Have you tried optimising a local delay to placing your orders, balancing the chance of getting there first versus having your orders not be rejected?

text:
thats interesting… although like i said I’ve been profitable with this and i want to keep it that way, the last thing i want to do is get excluded by pissing Betfair off trying some back-door.

Would love to learn more tho for my own understanding.

text: mo: I think thats my job for the weekend, I’m going to have to put some sort of delay in their because im now finding that im not first to market

text: sounds weird reading that back, but id rather try once and be at the front of the queue, over thrying 5 times, racking up errors, pissing off Betfair & still being beaten to market

elements.text: sounds weird reading that back, but id rather try once and be at the front of the queue, over thrying 5 times, racking up errors, pissing off Betfair & still being beaten to market

text: In my experience they’re not going to just close your account if you “abuse” some part of their tech stack. They’ll ask you to change what you’re doing. You’re earning them commission after all

elements.text: In my experience they’re not going to just close your account if you “abuse” some part of their tech stack. They’ll ask you to change what you’re doing. You’re earning them commission after all

text: Well thats a relief!

elements.text: Well thats a relief!

text: Yeah this is exactly what I’m thinking. No point trying to bet without giving the market time to be responsive first if you’re still going to get beaten

text: Props for being able to get there first for so long. Would've thought that domain was dominated long ago. But if it's just a matter of placing 1000s of orders / sec than whats to stop everyone from trying it and overloading the API

elements.text: Props for being able to get there first for so long. Would've thought that domain was dominated long ago. But if it's just a matter of placing 1000s of orders / sec than whats to stop everyone from trying it and overloading the API

text: True but it’s always hard to balance between spending time on something new that might not pan out versus improving an established strategy that you know works

elements.text: True but it’s always hard to balance between spending time on something new that might not pan out versus improving an established strategy that you know works

text: Theres a bit more to it than just smashing the server… I’ve probably not explained things very well. Sometimes when betfair publish their markets there is no delay, and then its a simple as getting your bet on quick, I’m pleased to say my code-base is quite good at this and I’m first to market more often than not. If all markets were published and in a ready state then I would not need to retry, and like i said if 1 retry is effectively 150 attempts (150 runners across 10 markets published simultaneously) you really rack up the errors quite quickly

text: is there anything in the first update that tells you that your initial place is going to be rejected?

elements.text: is there anything in the first update that tells you that your initial place is going to be rejected?

text: Not to my knowledge, I just listen to the Stream API like everyone else.

elements.text: Not to my knowledge, I just listen to the Stream API like everyone else.

text: So you you listen to streaming api for new published market/s, then you place 1.01 lay bets on any market selection. If you say betfair adds just 10 of markets in batch, how you can go in thousands of bets placed in 1 second? This strategy makes sense only for some market types, limit that to reduce amount of placed bets.

elements.text: So you you listen to streaming api for new published market/s, then you place 1.01 lay bets on any market selection. If you say betfair adds just 10 of markets in batch, how you can go in thousands of bets placed in 1 second? This strategy makes sense only for some market types, limit that to reduce amount of placed bets.

text: Would you even be matched by being the first to lay at 1.01 / back at 1000 ? Are there other people rushing to place 1.01 back / 1000 lay?

elements.text: Would you even be matched by being the first to lay at 1.01 / back at 1000 ? Are there other people rushing to place 1.01 back / 1000 lay?

text: It's a well known edge to be the first matched at 1.01 in horse racing markets (applicable in play)

elements.text: It's a well known edge to be the first matched at 1.01 in horse racing markets (applicable in play)

text: Sure, but that isn’t as soon as the market_id comes online?

text: Well that's how you get in front of the queue?
